refnamediv.refpurpose: The ATK interface which provides standard mechanism for manipulating hyperlinks.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "link-selected" void user_function (AtkHypertext *atkhypertext, gint arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: An interface used for objects which implement linking between multiple resource or content locations, or multiple 'markers' within a single document. A Hypertext instance is associated with one or more Hyperlinks, which are associated with particular offsets within the Hypertext's included content. While this interface is derived from Text, there is no requirement that Hypertext instances have textual content; they may implement Image as well, and Hyperlinks need not have non-zero text offsets.

refsect2.title: AtkHypertext
refsect2.para: The AtkHypertext structure does not contain any fields.

refsect2.title: atk_hypertext_get_link ()

listitem.simpara: the number of links within this hypertext document

refsect2.title: atk_hypertext_get_link_index ()
refsect2.para: Gets the index into the array of hyperlinks that is associated with the character specified by char_index.

listitem.simpara: an index into the array of hyperlinks in hypertext, or -1 if there is no hyperlink associated with this character.

refsect2.title: The "link-selected" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AtkHypertext *atkhypertext, gint arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run last
refsect2.para: The "link-selected" signal is emitted by an AtkHyperText object when one of the hyperlinks associated with the object is selected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
the index of the hyperlink which is selected
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
